Class Dolphinity

  • java.lang.Object
    • Dolphinity
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable

    public class Dolphinity
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Runnable
    Main class. Runs the dolphinity game and sets up the JFrame with a Panel. Implements Runnable so that the game is threaded
    Version:
    5.0.0 06.09.2015 Alex - Updated Time Spent as of June 9, 2015: 20.5 Hours - making menus and editing, refinement, and shortcuts - continue vs new game functionality Jordan - Updated Time Spent as of June 9, 2015: 24 Hours - Made frames to help program flow - running actual game Together - Updated Time Spent as of June 9, 2015: 5.5 Hours - mainly fixing glitches so it works
    Author:
    J Levy and A Barkin

    • Constructor Detail

      • Dolphinity

        public Dolphinity()
        The main constructor sets up every frame and panel, loads the fish and garbage images, and starts the game Thread

        Local variables:

        i for loop variable to go through the file names of fish and garbage

        e IOException caught for reading images from files

        loops:

        1st for loop used to run through every endangered fish and load it into the array

        2nd for loop used to run through every garbage object image and load it into the array

        Try Catch blocks:

        1st Try Catch used to catch if the fishimage isn't found so the program does not crash.

        2nd Try Catch used to catch if the garbage image isn't found so the program does not crash.

    • Method Detail

      • run

        public void run()
        This method overrides the Runnable run() method, and is the threaded game loop. If it is a new game, fishes, garbages, dolphin, and background are initialized and the mainMenu() method is called. The score is reseet, and the dolphin's velocity in the x direction is set dependent on the level. In the game loop, garbage, fish, and hoops are spawned in. The dolphin, the fish, the garbage, and the background are moved. If the "escape" button is pressed, the goodbye panel is shown and the program exits.

        Local variables:

        e Exception caught for Thread sleeping

        loops:

        1st while loop used to refresh the game constantly only while it is running

        1st for loop used to refresh and move the dolphin 1000 times every frame

        2nd for loop used to refresh and move each fish every frame

        3rd for loop used to refresh and move each garbage every frame

        4th for loop used to refresh and move each hoop every frame

        Try Catch statements:

        1st Try Catch used to delay the checking and catch the thread.sleep so that it has time to register changes in the GamePanel

        Conditional Statements:

        1st if structure used to only reset the variables if the user starts a new round

        2nd if structure used to remove the last fish if there are 20 so the ArrayList does not become too large

        3rd if structure used to remove the last garbage if there are 20 so the ArrayList does not become too large

        4th if structure used to remove the last hoop if there are 20 so the ArrayList does not become too large

        5th if structure used to add a fish if a random double is smaller than a certain weighted average

        6th if structure used to add a garbage if a random double is smaller than a third of the weighted average

        7th if structure used to add a hoop if a random double is smaller than 0.0009

        8th if structure used to direct program flow depending on which option is clicked in GamePanel

        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable
